paragraphs.zh-tw: I'm Jessi, and this is my suitcase. But before I show you what I've got inside, I'm going to make a very public confession, and that is, I'm outfit-obsessed. I love finding, wearing, and more recently, photographing and blogging a different, colorful, crazy outfit for every single occasion.
paragraphs.en: 我是Jessi，這是我的旅行箱 在我給各位看我裡頭裝什麼東西之前 我要做一個非常公開的告白 就是 我對衣服極度迷戀 我超愛尋找它們並穿上它們 最近 還愛上拍衣服的照片，寫在部落格上 每一套與眾不同，色彩鮮豔，瘋狂的衣服 都有其最適切的場合

paragraphs.zh-tw: But I don't buy anything new. I get all my clothes secondhand from flea markets and thrift stores.
paragraphs.en: 但我不購買任何新品 我的衣服都是二手貨 從跳蚤市場和二手店買的

paragraphs.zh-tw: Aww, thank you. Secondhand shopping allows me to reduce the impact my wardrobe has on the environment and on my wallet.
paragraphs.en: 喔，謝謝你 二手購物 讓我減少 購買衣服對環境的影響 還有對荷包的影響

paragraphs.zh-tw: I get to meet all kinds of great people; my dollars usually go to a good cause; I look pretty unique; and it makes shopping like my own personal treasure hunt. I mean, what am I going to find today? Is it going to be my size? Will I like the color? Will it be under $20? If all the answers are yes, I feel as though I've won.
paragraphs.en: 我能認識各種有趣的人 我的錢通常會捐款給慈善事業 我的打扮自樹一格 同時購物變成我私人的尋寶之旅 我會想，今天會找到什麼？ 會剛好符合我的尺寸嗎？ 會是我喜歡的顏色嗎？ 價錢會低於二十塊美金嗎？ 如果答案都是「是」 我就覺得自己賺到了

paragraphs.zh-tw: I want to get back to my suitcase and tell you what I packed for this exciting week here at TED. I mean, what does somebody with all these outfits bring with her? So I'm going to show you exactly what I brought.
paragraphs.en: 回來談談我的旅行箱 告訴你們，為了來TED 這興奮的一週，我都帶了些什麼 這個有這麼多衣服的傢伙到底會帶些什麼？ 所以我要給你看到底我都帶了哪些衣物

paragraphs.zh-tw: I brought seven pairs of underpants and that's it. Exactly one week's worth of undies is all I put in my suitcase.
paragraphs.en: 我帶了七件內褲 就這樣 剛好夠穿一週的內褲 是我唯一放在旅行箱內的衣服

paragraphs.zh-tw: I was betting that I'd be able to find everything else I could possible want to wear once I got here to Palm Springs. And since you don't know me as the woman walking around TED in her underwear -- that means I found a few things.
paragraphs.en: 我敢說我在棕櫚泉 能夠找到 我需要的所有衣服 既然你們現在看到的我 不是一個只穿著內褲來參加TED的女人 這就說明了我的確找到了一些東西

paragraphs.zh-tw: And I'd really love to show you my week's worth of outfits right now. Does that sound good? So as I do this, I'm also going to tell you a few of the life lessons that, believe it or not, I have picked up in these adventures wearing nothing new.
paragraphs.en: 我現在真的很想讓你們看我這一週所穿的衣服 是不是聽起來很不錯？ 當然同時 我還會和各位聊聊生活的經驗 無論你們是否相信，這些都是 我在這趟冒險中體悟出來的想法

paragraphs.zh-tw: So let's start with Sunday. I call this "Shiny Tiger." You do not have to spend a lot of money to look great.
paragraphs.en: 那我們就從星期日開始 這叫這套「閃亮老虎」 你無須花大錢也能顯得氣質非凡

paragraphs.zh-tw: You can almost always look phenomenal for under $50. This whole outfit, including the jacket, cost me $55, and it was the most expensive thing that I wore the entire week.
paragraphs.en: 甚至你不用花到五十塊美金，就能令人印象深刻 這整套衣服，包含外套 用了我五十五塊美金 而這是我這一週內 穿得最貴的衣服

paragraphs.zh-tw: Monday: Color is powerful. It is almost physiologically impossible to be in a bad mood when you're wearing bright red pants.
paragraphs.en: 星期一：色彩是強大的 在生理學上，穿上明亮的紅色褲子時 幾乎不可能還覺得心情鬱悶

paragraphs.zh-tw: If you are happy, you are going to attract other happy people to you. Tuesday: Fitting in is way overrated.
paragraphs.en: 如果你快樂 你也會吸引到其他快樂的人 星期二： 主流被遠遠高估了

paragraphs.zh-tw: I've spent a whole lot of my life trying to be myself and at the same time fit in. Just be who you are.
paragraphs.en: 我一生中花了很多時間 想做自己 同時融入主流 就做你自己

paragraphs.zh-tw: If you are surrounding yourself with the right people, they will not only get it, they will appreciate it. Wednesday: Embrace your inner child.
paragraphs.en: 如果你身邊有對的人 他們不僅能了解 還會懂得欣賞 星期三： 擁抱你的童心

paragraphs.zh-tw: Sometimes people tell me that I look like I'm playing dress-up, or that I remind them of their seven-year-old. I like to smile and say, "Thank you." Thursday: Confidence is key.
paragraphs.en: 有時候有人會告訴我 說我像在玩打扮 或者我讓他們想起了他們七歲的孩子 我喜歡對他們微笑 然後說聲「謝謝」 星期四 自信是關鍵

paragraphs.zh-tw: If you think you look good in something, you almost certainly do. And if you don't think you look good in something, you're also probably right.
paragraphs.en: 如果你覺得你穿什麼衣服好看 那你一定會穿得好看 如果你不覺得你穿什麼好看 那你也可能是對的

paragraphs.zh-tw: I grew up with a mom who taught me this day-in and day-out. But it wasn't until I turned 30 that I really got what this meant.
paragraphs.en: 從小到大，我媽媽每天都告訴我這一點 但是我到了三十歲 才真正了解這意思

paragraphs.zh-tw: And I'm going to break it down for you for just a second. If you believe you're a beautiful person inside and out, there is no look that you can't pull off.
paragraphs.en: 我很快地為各位分析一下 如果你相信你是個美麗的人 從裡到外 那就沒有什麼衣服是你不能穿得好看的

paragraphs.zh-tw: So there is no excuse for any of us here in this audience. We should be able to rock anything we want to rock.
paragraphs.en: 所以在座各位你們不需要任何理由 我們想穿上什麼就穿上什麼

paragraphs.zh-tw: Thank you. Friday: A universal truth -- five words for you: Gold sequins go with everything.
paragraphs.en: 謝謝 星期五：一個普遍的真理 --送你們五字箴言 金亮片百搭

paragraphs.zh-tw: And finally, Saturday: Developing your own unique personal style is a really great way to tell the world something about you without having to say a word. It's been proven to me time and time again as people have walked up to me this week simply because of what I'm wearing, and we've had great conversations.
paragraphs.en: 最後，星期六： 展現獨特的個人風格 這是告訴別人你是誰的一個很好的方式 而且你一個字都不必說 這一點我已經證實過許多次 這星期當人們一次次走向我 只是因為我穿了什麼 我們有很愉快的交談

paragraphs.zh-tw: So obviously this is not all going to fit back in my tiny suitcase. So before I go home to Brooklyn, I'm going to donate everything back.
paragraphs.en: 當然這些衣服都不會放進 我的小旅行箱 所以在我回到布魯克林之前 我會把一切都捐回

paragraphs.zh-tw: Because the lesson I'm trying to learn myself this week is that it's okay to let go. I don't need to get emotionally attached to these things because around the corner, there is always going to be another crazy, colorful, shiny outfit just waiting for me, if I put a little love in my heart and look.
paragraphs.en: 因為這個星期我在教導自己 放手也是好的 我不需要眷戀東西 因為在下一個角落 永遠會有 另一套瘋狂的，五彩繽紛 閃閃發光的衣服 在等著我 只要我帶著愛去找尋

paragraphs.zh-tw: Thank you very much. Thank you.
paragraphs.en: 非常謝謝 謝謝
